459 Sekolah di DKI Jakarta Dapatkan Program Makanan Tambahan
05 Nov 2019, 02:33 by Tempo.co
INFO NASIONAL — Untuk meningkatkan kecukupan zat gizi pada anak sekolah, Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta menyelenggarakan program Penyediaan Makanan Tambahan Anak Sekolah (PMTAS). Tahun 2019, pemberian makanan tambahan ini dilakukan di 459 sekolah di DKI Jakarta. "Program PMTAS sudah menjangkau 53 kelurahan di Jakarta dengan mempertimbangkan faktor sosial ekonomi," ujar Gubernur DKI Jakarta, Anies Baswedan.
Gubernur Anies menyatakan, program yang diberikan Senin hingga Jumat ini bertujuan agar anak-anak usia dini mendapat asupan makanan sehat dan bergizi tinggi. Sehingga pertumbuhan jasmani dan intelektualitasnya bisa tumbuh dengan baik.
Program PMTAS telah dilakukan di 75 taman kanak-kanak dan taman pendidikan Al-Quran dengan jumlah 5.304 murid, 375 SD dengan peserta 137.718 murid, dan 9 sekolah luar biasa (SLB) dengan peserta 1.700 murid. Total siswa yang menikmati PMTAS sebanyak 144.722 orang.
Sebaran SDN dalam program PMTAS, yakni 3 sekolah di Kepulauan Seribu, 26 dan 28 sekolah di Jakarta Utara wilayah 1 dan 2, 19 dan 33 sekolah di Jakarta Pusat wilayah 1 dan 2. Berikutnya, 99 dan 35 sekolah di Jakarta Barat wilayah 1 dan 2, 61 sekolah di Jakarta Timur, serta 32 dan 39 sekolah di Jakarta Selatan wilayah 1 dan 2. “Ke depannya, pelaksanaan program itu akan terus dikembangkan agar bisa menjangkau seluruh wilayah dan semua sekolah di ibu kota,” kata Gubernur Anies.
Orang tua siswa menyambut baik program penyediaan makanan tambahan ini. Kristina (39) wali murid SDN di Johar Baru, Jakarta Pusat, mengatakan pemberian makanan tambahan bisa dibarengi dengan edukasi tentang gizi dan kebutuhan makanan sehat. “Ini perlu agar anak-anak lebih paham dan mengerti tentang makanan sehat bergizi tinggi yang dibutuhkan tubuh,” katanya.
Dari 29 varian menu program PMTAS, sekolah atau komite sekolah berupaya memperkenalkan para pelajar dengan makanan bergizi yang menggabungkan sayur-mayur dan buah-buahan.
Misalnya saja nagasari dan apel, roti dan jeruk, pisang dan telur rebus, sandwich isi telur dan duku, roti dan pisang, jasuke dan salak, lemper isi ayam dan lengkeng, kroket singkong isi sayur dan apel, martabak telur dan rambutan, kue wortel dan manggis, risoles isi sayuran dan sawo, serta puding buah dan jambu air.
“Sekolah atau komite bebas memilih menu sesuai dengan kemampuan komite dalam menyediakan menu-menu tersebut,” kata Kepala Seksi Peserta Didik dan Pembangunan Karakter Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta, Ida Nurbani. (*)

459 Schools in DKI Jakarta Get Additional Food Programs
05 Nov 2019, 02:33 by Tempo.co
NATIONAL INFO - To improve the adequacy of nutrients in school children, the Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta organizes a School Supplementary Food Supplement Program (PMTAS). In 2019, this supplementary feeding will be carried out in 459 schools in DKI Jakarta. "The PMTAS program has reached 53 urban villages in Jakarta by considering socio-economic factors," said DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan.
Governor Anies said that the program, which was given Monday to Friday, aims to provide children with healthy, nutritious food intake. So that physical growth and intellect can grow well.
The PMTAS program has been conducted in 75 kindergartens and Al-Quran education parks with a total of 5,304 students, 375 elementary schools with 137,718 students, and 9 special schools (SLB) with 1,700 students. Total students who enjoyed PMTAS were 144,722 people.
SDN distribution in PMTAS program, namely 3 schools in the Thousand Islands, 26 and 28 schools in North Jakarta region 1 and 2, 19 and 33 schools in Central Jakarta region 1 and 2. Next, 99 and 35 schools in West Jakarta region 1 and 2 , 61 schools in East Jakarta, and 32 and 39 schools in South Jakarta regions 1 and 2. "Going forward, the program will continue to be developed so that it can reach all regions and all schools in the capital," Governor Anies said.
Parents of students welcomed this supplementary food provision program. Kristina (39) a guardian of elementary school students in Johar Baru, Central Jakarta, said the provision of additional food can be accompanied by education about nutrition and healthy food needs. "This is necessary so that children understand and understand more about high nutritious healthy foods that the body needs," he said.
Of the 29 PMTAS program menu variants, the school or school committee seeks to introduce students to nutritious foods that combine vegetables and fruits.
For example, Nagasari and Apples, bread and oranges, bananas and boiled eggs, egg and duku sandwiches, bread and bananas, jasuke and salak, chicken and longan-filled lemper, vegetable and apple-filled cassava croquette, egg and rambutan martabak, carrot cake and mangosteen, risoles filled with vegetables and sapodilla, as well as fruit pudding and guava water.
"Schools or committees are free to choose menus according to the committee's ability to provide these menus," said the Head of the Student and Character Development Section of the DKI Jakarta Education Agency, Ida Nurbani. (*)
